Author: Tony Widhyanto
Review: The walking experience along sloping street with many souvenir shops and restaurants.. with lighting from afternoon to nite time is unforgettable..

Author: Wade Hindell
Review: When you visit Kyoto make sure you add this to your list.  This was one of our favorite places to visit the small narrow streets get very busy but it is well worth the hustle an bustle just for the people watching alone.

Author: Phillip Phung
Review: Definitely add this to your Kyoto visit along with Kiyomizudera, Sannenzaka and yasaka shrine. It's a great street with lovely shops. I wish I could buy more warabi mochi!

Author: Liz K.
Review: Vacationed to Japan, was in Kyoto for a night, and stayed off of Ninenzaka Street in a ryokan. Must see this place if in Kyoto. It takes you back to a different time. The architecture, landscaping, food, and sightseeing are unparalleled. An unforgettable place.

Author: Adrian Kristiansen
Review: Was unfortunately raining and all the stores were closed when I was there, but lots of nice buildings and interesting things to look at

Author: Peter Christiansen
Review: One of the most popular sites in Kyoto! So crowd, yet so fun! In the night this site is very beautiful. People loves to take pictures around here and this is the best site to introducing that you are in Kyoto üòÅ

Author: Casper Joosten
Review: A beautiful tiny street. When you think of traditional Japanese architecture this is probably what you think about. There are many food stalls and tea houses around with typical Japanese products. Definitely a must visit when you are in the Kyoto area!

Author: AV
Review:
Walking down the street is a nice way to understand what old Kyoto looked like, the path is filled with old buildings and shops. Many of the shops are just for tourists, with little authentic old style shops, but the walk up the path allows to reach a beautiful temple and shrine. It gets less crowded after 5pm, while before it is full of people walking up and down.
Reccomended to have a look at the buildings and do some shopping while in Kyoto. You can walk the entire path in 20 minutes and then visit the temples. Take the time to look over Kyoto once you reach the top of the hill for a great view of the city which is hard to get anywhere else.

Author: Darren Loh
Review: Very nice walking street where you can see historical Japanese shops, streets food and many souvenirs store, periodically you may see tourists wearing kimono walking around

Author: Akiradna V
Review:
It was an old area near temple.There are Starbuck store here designed with traditional Japanese house.
Walk early in the morning to enjoy the old area with many traditional houses along the path without too many crowded tourist.

Author: J T
Review:
Can get a bit crowded at times. Slowly walk up the hill and take in the beautiful Japanese architecture. Do visit one of the traditional teahouses. Take a step back in time, enjoy a hot cup of matcha and sample traditional Japanese dessert.

Nothing much to do at night though.

Author: Ray Chen
Review: Even though there is a hidden Starbucks on the main strip, it's blended in so well you may not even notice it during your walk through the street.  The shops are beautiful and the recommendation is to go at night, where the true beauty shines

Author: JJ Taylor
Review: Aside from the crowds, this spot is great for finding gifts and you also get a great view heading up the street.

Author: Nicole Noche
Review: Historical and traditional-looking Japanese buildings in Kyoto that have several places to buy souvenirs and grab a bite to eat. Some items can be overpriced due to it being a tourist spot, so be aware of prices for different items you may be interested in. Can get very crowded during peak season, as evidenced by my photo. Worth taking a trip to if you want to rent kimonos and walk around in them for a day or to take in the sites of the buildings.

Author: Gregory Mitchell
Review: Experience old Japanese architecture with traditional souvenir shops while ascending or descending the Kiyomizu-dera temple area.

Author: Christophe Vielet
Review:
This district is a peace of heaven in kyoto's City. It's seems to be out of the time, because of the architecture of because of some geisha or japanese people that you can see in kimono/yukata.
You can also take some rest in the different restaurant around the street.
If you walk a little bit you can see a ghibli shop which is a way back to childhood if you're a fan of japanimation/ghibli/miyazaki.

If you visit kyoto, add this district to your list.

Author: KahFui Lim
Review:
As the dusk sets in and temperature plummets down to 7¬∞C. It‚Äôs a wonderful time to have a short stroll back to Á•áÂúí (Gion) and grab a bit of snacks along the way before dinner.

Walking down the lane with scenic view of Yasaka Pagoda as backdrop.

Author: Boon Sim Ho
Review: Nice old feel neighbourhood, we visited during the Hanatoro Festival and shops open til about 8.30pm. This place usually closes around 6pm, lucky us.

Author: Kevin Zhao
Review: Lots of shops to explore very touristy. I went on a drizzling day, which drove a lot of tourist away. People dressed up and taking photos everywhere. When the weather cleared up the street became full. See photos to compare.

Author: maya desai
Review: Beautiful place to visit - albeit a little touristy. Wonderful small shops where you can buy lots of little gifts. Very picturesque.

Author: Benjamin de Leon
Review: Prepare to exhaust yourself physically (because it is a steep walk upwards), financially (because it is a great spot to buy souveniers such as kitsune masks, ceramics from nearby Kiyomizu-dera, furin or wind chimes, mochi, wallets, local snacks, etc.)

Author: Arnold Arkar Moore
Review: This place is beautiful and great for photos, please be mindful as some shops and streets prohibit photography. Best to come here at around 1600, as most of the stores will still be open. I read on a guide that it's best to come at night but I was sorely disappointed as most of the shops were closed. Coming at 1600 and taking a stroll around until its evening would be better as you can shop and take photos. This place looks lovely at night but be careful and watch your step. The kimono rental here is pretty reasonably priced at around 3000 yen, if you're interested. If you happened to come here late, and there's no restaurants open, I suggest walking down to Pontocho, and having a meal there as it is open till late. Be prepared for a lot of walking however as this area is huge!

Author: Ken&TongTong
Review: Do dress up in kimono and stroll up to the temple, nice experience to feel what it's like to be japanese. U won't feel awkward as there are many local n tourist doing it, it's quite fun with the excellent atmosphere.

Author: Ian Gore
Review: Mmmm...sweets. A great tourist attraction and a fun stop on your way to somewhere else. Never seen so many samples in a store before in Japan.

Author: Anis Izzati
Review: You can find unique souvenir here n also view the japanese village house n temple design..

Author: SR M
Review: Beautiful Kyoto walking spot. Stores will close early on weekend. People are nice and they usually understand English, Chinese and Korean

Author: Jonas Grincius (Jonas12611)
Review: Amazing place to visit any season, winter or spring, any time of day or night. You will feel and smell Japan. In the late evening when lights are on this allay is crowd less and You may enjoy lonely stroll.

Author: Xibei Wang
Review: Had pretty good browsing experience here. Stores are all cute, despite the people. So many samples eating places that I was actually full. The wide variety of pickles is like heaven for pickle lovers. We can‚Äôt help but bought quite a lot. There are also nice cafes where you can rest your leg and take a cupcake.

Author: Pno Ens
Review: A very touristy part of Kyoto. Loved the splendid sakura tree hanging out from the old stores. There‚Äôre tons of tourists, of course. The slightly tilted but wide stairways were easy to walk on. The Starbucks which recently opened became another trendy spot! Highly recommend this area for visitors!

Author: Dani
Review:
It's like walking through the streets of an old era.
They can get pretty crowded with tourists and the taverns are a little overpriced but it's worth the visit

Author: Julien Chabe
Review: Did it by day and by night. Night time is way better. Lights give it a totally different dimension which is worth experiencing. Day time is fun too but filled with tourist and the main point being shops in daytime.

Author: iam yoja
Review: It was near dark when I reached here. The alley here always welcome you with nice tranquil view...just nice üòåüòå. If you want to feel the classic japanese atmosphere this is one of the best choice

Author: Kevin Youn
Review: Tonnes of tourists from all over the world and is extremely crowded. But it‚Äôs a must if you want to enjoy Japanese architecture and atmosphere. There are a lot of cafes and shops located in this area in case you want to have a break.

Author: Peter Newman
Review:
Never seen so many foreign tourists in one place and we arrived at Tokyo first.

Walk was about 15mins from the station, just follow the crowd if you are unsure of where to go. Once there it's nice but the whole area is actually amazing, bring your comfy shoes and camera, there's also lots of options for food, only issue is there are not many bins and toilets about so be mindful.

Author: K Rowland
Review: Within walking distance of both the Yasaka Shrine and Kiyomizu-dera -- not to mention Pontocho after you've made the rounds in the area. Of course, the night views are worth it as well

Author: Vitamin K
Review: A beautiful Japanese old street to walk along, you can find many shops selling souvenirs, loca foods and arts. Very inspiring streets

Author: Brett Gottfried
Review: This part of town has reconstructed buildings that are made to look old. It is a busy touristy here but still fun to look around. You will also get a really good view of Kyoto if you make it to the top of the hill

Author: Jun Mao Tan
Review: Good place to do night photography if you're interested. There are still some tourist around, just wait awhile for till there's no one. All shops are closed at night. There are still vending machines if you need a drink

Author: Dr. Michael Kohlberger, BSc MSc
Review: Quite good actually. Charming atmosphere, especially in the evening, and the shops offer creative handcrafted pieces of art. Some of the chops have cheaply produced tourist items, but even there the selection is quite good, and one would be willing to pay the price. I've seen a few touristy places in Kyoto now, and this one is definitely in the upper quality range.

Author: allen teo
Review:
Some parts are crowded, some parts are quiet
Depends which route you chose, it's always beautiful along the way till the end

Author: Tania S
Review: Great place to visited every building still in the old fashion way with people wearing kimono walking around that bring back a good view. You will never get tired of walking eventho it a long trail to connect to Kiyomizu dera temple, easy walk and you will shop until you drop

Author: Michael Saragih
Review: One of my favorite site on Kyoto. When you walking around there, you feel like you're walking in an old Kyoto area. And there's also a Starbucks on an old style Japanese building. Great place.

Author: Tammy Liu
Review: We were originally attractive by the special Starbucks shop here.  But, once here, we really like this area.  The houses  all looked so interesting, well maintained and together, they make this area a very enjoyable walking tour.

Author: natali abhirama
Review: The japanese traditional houses were awesome. You can buy food and souvenirs along the street. Take beautiful photos. There were lots of people tho

Author: Smruti M
Review: Its one of the iconic streets of Kyoto City, that represents Japan‚Äôs good old days.Picture perfect ,nostalgic and a historical street.This street leads to the famous Kiyomizudera Temple and also one of the main attraction of the city for its beautiful scenery.The historical stone paved streets are lined with traditional Japanese buildings, shops, cafes and inns, and are also surrounded by several famous landmarks.It also houses The World's First Tatami Starbucks.A street worth visiting to have a Japanese cultural experience.

Author: Kingston Obike
Review: Such a beautiful area with rich historical significance and cultural heritage. In the day or at night, this is a great area to visit.

Author: Xue Meng
Review: Lovely place. Good to learn the national history and culture by seeing their shops and  commercials ;)

Author: anika suki (anika_suki)
Review: As usual the place was full of tourists. Worth visiting the place.

Author: Shu Yee
Review: Very kyoto-ish. Suggest to go on weekdays and as soon as the sunrise because everyone is still sleeping. That you can take nice photo. But most shops open around at 10am.

Author: Alexandros Papafotiou
Review: Beautiful place but typically fairly crowded. You‚Äôll see people waiting to take photos‚Ä¶

Author: Pallab Pain
Review: A very instragammable spot. You can see a lot of people dressed up in kimonos here. Best visited around dusk or probably dawn. Over a weekend, this place gets very crowded.

Author: Ken Teh
Review: Great old town with historical style shops along the way, great place to getaway from cities and buildings.. great place to take photos as well..

Author: Canh Tran
Review: Great shops and restaurants. Nice place for a stroll and snacks along the way.

Author: Yurin
Review: Come very early in the morning (I was there about 7am ish) you‚Äôll get the entire place for yourself

Author: Marc
Review: A very quaint shopping street flooded with many ladies wearing kimonos and students from all parts of Japan. The shops there were fairly interesting, many selling delicacies of all sorts. I loved the spicy steamed pork bun. Tinted an orange-red colour, the pork melts in your mouth, the bun fluffy and light. The ice cream (soft served) was also out of this world. It‚Äôs located near the top of this street but a bite of this dessert was worth the walk.

Author: Anze Hao
Review: crowded during the day but pretty empty at night

Author: A G (Kawa Ninja)
Review: It is a very touristy place so do expect it to be crowded. There's many places to eat, drink and shop. Many people come early for that signature sunrise photo.

Author: Tony Huang
Review: I loved this historical part of town!

Author: Staecha G
Review: Very iconic spot. Suggest going early to avoid large crowds. There are a lot of quaint stores and plenty of activities to occupy your time. Also great for shopping

Author: Francis Cheung
Review: Very beautiful place you can't miss. Better to come early in the morning to avoid crowd of people and take good picture.

Author: Ree-Gent H'ng
Review: Very beautiful at night. Huge contrast to the chaotic day time scenery. Had a very nice stroll after dinner.

Author: Salim Lakhani
Review: Must visit if you're in Kyoto! Don't forget to check out the Starbucks there... It's *very different than any other that you've been too - only one with the brown wood sign!

Author: Debra March
Review: Beautiful, but very touristy. I was hoping for more traditional, not Starbucks in an old looking building

Author: Dorothy Wong
Review: Super duper busy during New Year's Day (Jan 1st 2023)

Author: Mohd Adizam Amram
Review: Good if you plan to have a good experience time to know and see how look Japanese old shop at old different era.. The shop still look like the Samurai era time.. I suggest, you better buy the JR West Line ticket and you can rode all JR train from Osaka, Nara, Kyoto, Kobe or Okayama area.. With that ticket, you can ride shinkansen from Shin-Osaka to Okayama station.. If want to reserve any seat, you need to inform to the ticket counter first before ride the shinkansen.. Because non-reserve seat only available for 3 cars.. So, I cannot guarantee any available seatfoe that 3 cars..

Author: Nin Roberts
Review: A quirky olden day village area surprisingly close to our central hotel. Hidden away in the small alleyways of Kyoto, it‚Äôs bustling with many vendor stores that sell tourist objects clothing food etc. There pathway leads up to a temple at the top so it‚Äôs not the most pram friendly but it can be a very relaxing picturesque walk. We came on a weekday and it was still very crowded with foreigners and school trips.

Author: LU
Review: Kyoto style ! Kyoto love ‚ù§Ô∏è

Author: hisyamuddin harun
Review: Great walking experience with best souvenior shop and japanese traditional look shoplot. A place like no otherr

Author: Harr22
Review:
Good to see
Good to eat
Good to walk

Good

Author: Simon Raymundo
Review: Great atmosphere when you get here early enough. Come early around 8-9 AM before most shops open if you want to get some good photo ops.

Author: Sophie Solioz
Review: It's a nice area that really represents Kyoto well. We went in the afternoon during the week and it was so packed with people we didn't really enjoy walking around that much, but I've been there 2 other times in the past and loved it.

Author: Adelaine Gelain
Review: Shopping street pretty nice, they also have ghibli store!

Author: Ana
Review:
A must visit in Kyoto. Historic location with a lot of small shops, restaurants and kimono rentals.

Arrived around 10am there are already a lot of people. Shops usually opens around that time too. Make sure to visit first the traditional Starbuck or later in the afternoon.

Author: F
Review: A must visit spot on my list, packed with people during the rush hours, many shops to go in this area, and so many great spots for photo.

Author: YY
Review:
Chanced upon this stretch of shops quite unexpectedly as we strolled from Nanzenji temple to Kiyomizu - it was a great find because there‚Äôs something to shop (both dine and shop) while we make our way through the stretches of temples in this Eastern part of Kyoto!

Definitely recommended to everyone to try this trail/hike out, from Philosophers Path to Nanzenji to Kiyomizu üòä and you will pass by this stretch of good pit stops to get your stomach and shopping fix!

Side note: This reminds us of Jiufen Old Street in Taiwan üëçüèª

Author: Athleticgirl 86
Review: Very nicely laid out facility. Please note where you are allowed to take photos - this should of course be out of respect. Go there, let it work on you, enjoy the nature.  Amazing. Very friendly staff.

Author: Hendra Liu
Review: Best place to experience Japan in the olden days.

Author: Fran
Review: Beautiful place, I do recommend to arrive early before 9 am after that the crowds start to arrive and it is hard to walk. Famous starburst will be the only thing open at 8 am.

Author: Marry Lady
Review: Here is like old Kyoto vibes so I definitely recommend you to take pictures here.  and of course don't forget to visit starbucks in Kyoto style

Author: Adrian Lim (drianlim)
Review: I went during the early hours before 6am during sunrise. There‚Äôs maybe up to 5 people taking photos/videos around the area.

Author: sarayut siriwitpakdeekun
Review: It's very suitable for taking pictures

Author: SL Wong
Review: Nearby to Sannenzaka is this street. It's very similar to Sannenzaka, but this street has more of an olden day vibe. There's this chilli house that's quite a must visit! Lots of chilli related items.

Author: Ma√´na Ferauge
Review: Really enjoyed this place, probably one of my favourite places during my trip to Kyoto! Went there on a sunday, was very crowded in the middle of the afternoon so i recommend everyone to go probably during weekdays.

Author: Salazar oder Hansruedi
Review: A lot of intressting stores, also a small but charmful ghibli store is to be found here. If you visit Fushima Inari Shrines, you can also make a walk here and enjoy the different kinds of specialities they offer here.

Author: Sherry Phong
Review:
Ninenzaka is a historic district in Kyoto, Japan, known for its traditional buildings, narrow streets, and stone pavement. Based on its reputation and popularity, here is my review:

Five stars out of five for Nineizaka! This beautiful district is a must-visit for anyone traveling to Kyoto, especially for those interested in traditional Japanese culture and architecture. The area is filled with shops, cafes, and temples, and it's a great place to wander around and soak in the atmosphere.

The streets are lined with old buildings, many of which have been converted into shops selling traditional Japanese goods such as pottery, clothing, and sweets. The stone pavement and narrow streets add to the historic charm of the area.

One of the most famous attractions in Ninenzaka is Kiyomizu-dera Temple, which offers stunning views of the city from its hilltop location. Visitors can also enjoy tea ceremonies, try on traditional Japanese clothing, and explore the various temples and shrines in the area.

Overall, Nineizaka (Ninenzaka) is a fantastic destination for those looking to experience traditional Japanese culture and architecture. Its rich history, picturesque streets, and vibrant atmosphere make it a five-star destination in my book

Author: Pascual Andra
Review: Amazing walk leading to the temple at the top. Quite crowded but wonderful stores along the way

Author: Nathan Shae
Review: Busy little street with old-style buildings. Even Starbucks is in the traditional Japanese style. Fun to walk around and reminds me a little of Lombard street.

Author: wendy distelmans
Review: Very nice area but hugely overcrowded and spoiled by souvenir shops

Author: Amy Singh
Review: Nice shopping street but come early if you care to just walk and enjoy the sights. By 9 AM it‚Äôs packed even though most stores don‚Äôt open until 10.

Author: Tihomira Parichkova
Review:
Beautiful but crowded during holidays and weekdays.

We visited on Friday and it took us longer than usual to go though the whole place due to the huge amount of people there.

Author: Roxanne augurelt
Review: Such a stunning place at night and in the day all the buildings looked oh so lovely in this district.

Author: Jose Sales Fern√°ndez
Review: Beautiful views, specially during sunset but it is extremely crowded

Author: Kevin
Review: Went here at 530-6am to get some good photos without crowds. Would recommend coming back when everything is opened as well as there are a lot of cool shops.

Author: Grace Tang
Review: Very pretty, lots of shops for souvenirs- does get crowded.

Author: Ruben Royackers
Review: Famous place for souvenirs and Kyoto pictures, expect it to be crowded!

Author: William Castleberry
Review: Best part of Kyoto! A must see for all tourists.

Author: Marcus Chow
Review: Very popular street with lots of snacks, restaurants and souvenirs

Author: Awan Radzwan
Review: Good exercise and awesome place to see historical architecture

Author: Jack L
Review: Another must visit for any visit to Kyoto. The walk up to Kyomizu and walk down to Yakasa Pagoda is filled with shops and snacks that can satisfy almost anyone.  These types of experiences are not easily found anywhere which makes it a special place in Kyoto for me.

Author: Kelvin Tan
Review: Went at 4pm and crowd was ok. Some shops were already closed. Evening or later is still good time to go see all the beautiful houses and for sunset photo taking.
